turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Adaptive Redaction.
turn.2: Adaptive Redaction Adaptive Redaction is an intelligent version of redaction whereby sensitive parts of a document are automatically removed based on policy.
turn.4: It is primarily used in next generation Data Loss Prevention (DLP) solutions.
turn.6: The policy is a set of rules based on content and on context.
turn.8: Context can include:  Content can be 'visible' information, such as that you see on the screen.
turn.9: Is that all the context does?
turn.10: It can also be 'invisible' information such as that in document properties and revision history, and it can also be 'active' content which has been embedded in an electronic document, such as a macro.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Adaptive Redaction is designed to alleviate "False Positive" events created with Data loss prevention software (DLP) security solutions.
